text:
We have operates a http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx site.

User request is done in http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx. 
index.html to be forwarded to the index.jsp and index.jsp consist of a plurality of image files.

User not all show an abnormal response, users of unspecified were received 302 HTTP response.
Some of image file shows the response of abnormal, such as the following TCP Dump.

If User request a js/default.js, server responses QbjiX/js/default.js.
Such as 5 letters like QbjiX are attached.

Abnormal character is not a unique. Also characters change randomly. 
General features, they consist five words of English

Could you support me why this happens...



## TCP Dump by wireshark
(1) client -> server
GET /js/default.js HTTP/1.1
Accept: */*Referer: http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx/index.jsp
Accept-Language: ko
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; Mozilla/4.0
(compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1) ; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 
3.5.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
If-Modified-Since: Tue, 09 Jun 2009 04:24:34 GMT
If-None-Match: "1bc3-309d-bc5f8480
"Host: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: WMONID=PxnZ3nWQYmZ; zoom_val=100;
JSESSIONID=3pjZSXLQS2p2rpDrMvLG00htMDTVyWLspr6PThtvYny2yKS1Q41P!-1394213235!-599665236!7003!-1

(2) server -> client
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Connection: close
Pragma: no-cache
cache-control: no-cache
Location: /QbjiX/js/default.js
creator: poison7th@naver.com
covener@gmail.com
text:
This release is end of life, and you're on an ancient service level of it.

It seems more likely that this redirect is set by the application or some malicious code. If you can demonstrate a bug on a modern release, reopen -- bugzilla is for bug reporting, not support.
